intro: Seris onoseroides, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and similar plants. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, blooming in spring and summer. It has a bushy growth habit with gray-green, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Seris onoseroides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry, well-drained soils.
